01

About Me

Hello, I'm Melody

I dedicate myself to crafting eye-catching websites with a strong attention to the way users interact with them. I stand for building meaningful and engaging digital experiences accessible to all, making a point of developping layouts that will adapt to different type of media, whether it's a desktop monitor, a tablet or mobile phone.

Coming from a different career path, my skills are quite varied, including illustration : whether it's a set of icons, a character or a full environment, anything is possible.

In a past life

I've worked in the Visual Effects industry as a Lead Environment TD in London, and a Virtual Art Department Set Lead in Los Angeles, building CG environments for movies. Click here to see my demoreel.

My collaboration with the Software Department made me discover the world of programming, as well as UX and UI challenges. Combined with my past Visual Communication and Graphic Design studies, it lead me towards front-end web development and web design.

Make it happen

It's a passion for anything digital and a strong will to succeed in this new career path that animates me. I am constantly learning and always up for a new challenge. My previous career gave me a broad set of organisational and creative skills as well as a habit to collaborate with a wide range of people.

To strenghten my skills, I am now looking for an internship or a junior position, if you'd like to talk about it, please do not hesitate to contact me.

A few fun facts

  • – I have lived in 3 different countries
  • – I've held the Best Visual Effect Oscar, BAFTA and VES awards for the Jungle Book movie, being part of the incredible team that put it together.
  • – I've hidden one of the 'easter egg' Mickey Mouse on the Jungle Book movie.

R & M's Wedding

Description

Wedding websites are becomming particularly popular as they allow couples to share a lot of information in one single place as well as manage reservations in a much easier way than collecting rsvp cards. Although a lot of platform exists to create them, the themes to choose from are quite restrained and there's a good chance they won't match the theme and colours of the wedding. It was definitely the case for us : the venue and design choices we had made wouldn't translate to a template.

The goal of this website were :

  • – easy to use : a simple design that doesn't confuse the users,
  • – to be informative,
  • – easy to maintain and add new sections when needed,
  • – responsive on all the main devices : desktop, tablets and phones,
  • – to adapt to older browsers,
  • – to respect the design of the invitations.

Design

We've kept the blue and peach colors of the chosen palette as well as the handwritten font of the invitations all the way through. The website is split in clear categories to help the users navigate. There are a few animations, very discreet to avoid confusion and long loading time.

See my code on github →

Explore California

Description

This travel website describes one of the most weel-known roadtrip through California following the Pacific Coast Highway. Visit the website to get the full experience as it has a few animations.

The goal of this website were :

  • – to help the user plan his trip with the main stops information,
  • – to work on any device, for practicity durin the trip,
  • – to allow expension if more stops are added,
  • – to be visually attractive

Design

On a technical level, it was an opportunity to experiment mainly with :
  • – AJAX calls to an API,
  • – use ES6 classes to manage both data and UI, allowing scalability.

See my code on github →

Busy Bee Studio

Description

Busy Bee Studio is a pretend craft center offering different types of art and craft classes. A lot of craft centers and classes have fairly old websites or none at all making it harder for them to attract a new public. The idea was to design an engaging website where people could learn more about the center, teachers and book classes online.

The goal of this website were :

  • – design an engaging website to attract a wide public,
  • – create a fresh visual identity,
  • – a flexible UI easy to navigate.

On a technical level, it was an opportunity to experiment with :

  • – javascript to create sliders and gallery,
  • – complex media queries which adapt to the screen orientation.

Design

The target audience is in majority women, but the age range can be quite wide depending the classes. I decided to keep a pastel palette of colours to give the website a fresh and dynamic look while keeping readibility to its maximum.

See my code on github →
